Terms of Service

Last updated: January 2025

1. Agreement to Terms

These Terms of Service ("Terms") constitute a legally binding agreement between you ("Client," "you," or "your") and Cloud Intelligence South Africa ("Cloud Intelligence," "we," "us," or "our") regarding your use of our software development services and website.

By engaging our services, accessing our website, or entering into a project agreement with us, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, do not use our services.

2. Services Description

2.1 Professional Services

Cloud Intelligence provides boutique software engineering services including:

  • Custom Software Development: Enterprise-grade web applications, data platforms, and AI solutions
  • Data Engineering: ETL pipeline development, data integration, and analytics platforms
  • Cloud Architecture: Cloud-native solutions, infrastructure design, and migration services
  • AI Integration: Machine learning implementation, generative AI solutions, and automation
  • Consulting Services: Technical advisory, architecture review, and strategic guidance
  • Maintenance & Support: Ongoing technical support, updates, and system maintenance

2.2 Service Standards

All services are provided according to our core values of correctness, quality, value, craftsmanship, and systems thinking. We maintain enterprise-grade security standards and follow industry best practices.

3. Engagement Process

3.1 Project Initiation

All projects begin with:

  • Initial consultation to understand requirements
  • Detailed discovery and requirements analysis
  • Proposal with scope, timeline, and pricing
  • Signed Statement of Work (SOW) or Service Agreement

3.2 Statement of Work

Each project is governed by a specific Statement of Work that includes:

  • Detailed project scope and deliverables
  • Timeline and milestones
  • Pricing and payment terms
  • Technical specifications and requirements
  • Acceptance criteria and testing procedures

4. Client Responsibilities

To ensure successful project delivery, clients are responsible for:

  • Requirements: Providing clear, accurate, and complete project requirements
  • Access: Granting necessary access to systems, data, and stakeholders
  • Feedback: Providing timely feedback and approvals at designated milestones
  • Testing: Participating in user acceptance testing and validation
  • Compliance: Ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations in your jurisdiction
  • Data: Providing accurate data and maintaining data quality standards
  • Communication: Maintaining clear communication channels and designated points of contact

5. Payment Terms

5.1 Pricing Structure

We offer flexible pricing models:

  • Fixed Price Projects: Total project cost defined in SOW
  • Time & Materials: Hourly or daily rates for ongoing work
  • Monthly Retainers: Recurring monthly fees for ongoing services
  • Value-Based Pricing: Pricing tied to business outcomes and value delivered

5.2 Payment Schedule

Unless otherwise specified in the SOW:

  • Fixed price projects: 50% upfront, 50% upon completion
  • Large projects: Payments tied to milestone completion
  • Monthly retainers: Due at the beginning of each month
  • Time & materials: Invoiced monthly in arrears

5.3 Late Payments

Late payments may result in:

  • Suspension of services until payment is received
  • Interest charges of 1.5% per month on overdue amounts
  • Termination of agreement for payments more than 30 days overdue

6. Intellectual Property

6.1 Client-Owned IP

Upon full payment of all fees, clients receive:

  • Full ownership of custom code developed specifically for their project
  • Rights to use, modify, and distribute the delivered software
  • Access to source code and documentation
  • Rights to all project-specific intellectual property created

6.2 Cloud Intelligence IP

We retain ownership of:

  • Pre-existing intellectual property and proprietary methodologies
  • Reusable code libraries and frameworks developed by us
  • General knowledge, skills, and experience gained during projects
  • Third-party software and tools used in development

6.3 Third-Party Components

Software may include third-party components subject to their respective licenses. We will identify significant third-party components and their license requirements.

7. Confidentiality

7.1 Mutual Confidentiality

Both parties agree to maintain confidentiality of:

  • Proprietary business information and trade secrets
  • Technical specifications and system architectures
  • Financial information and pricing details
  • Customer data and business processes

7.2 Exceptions

Confidentiality obligations do not apply to information that:

  • Is publicly available through no breach of this agreement
  • Was known prior to disclosure
  • Is received from a third party without breach of confidentiality
  • Must be disclosed by law or court order

8. Warranties and Disclaimers

8.1 Service Warranties

We warrant that:

  • Services will be performed with professional skill and care
  • Work will conform to the specifications in the SOW
  • We have the right and authority to enter into this agreement
  • Services will comply with applicable laws and regulations

8.2 Software Warranties

For delivered software, we provide:

  • 90-day warranty against defects in workmanship
  • Correction of bugs and errors identified during warranty period
  • Performance according to agreed specifications

8.3 Disclaimers

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH HEREIN, WE MAKE NO WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

9. Limitation of Liability

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW:

  • Our total liability shall not exceed the total fees paid under the relevant SOW
  • We shall not be liable for indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages
  • We shall not be liable for loss of profits, revenue, data, or business opportunities
  • Claims must be brought within one year of the cause of action arising

These limitations apply regardless of the theory of liability, whether in contract, tort, or otherwise.

10. Indemnification

10.1 Client Indemnification

Client agrees to indemnify us against claims arising from:

  • Client's use of delivered software beyond the scope of our agreement
  • Modification of our work by parties other than us
  • Client's violation of applicable laws or regulations
  • Third-party claims related to client-provided content or data

10.2 Our Indemnification

We will indemnify client against claims that our original work directly infringes third-party intellectual property rights, provided client promptly notifies us and allows us to control the defense.

11. Termination

11.1 Termination for Convenience

Either party may terminate the agreement with 30 days written notice. Upon termination:

  • Client pays for all work completed to date
  • We deliver all work products completed as of termination date
  • Both parties return confidential information

11.2 Termination for Breach

Either party may terminate immediately upon material breach by the other party, provided the breaching party fails to cure the breach within 15 days of written notice.

11.3 Effect of Termination

Upon termination, all rights and obligations cease except for:

  • Payment obligations for work performed
  • Confidentiality obligations
  • Intellectual property rights
  • Limitation of liability provisions

12. Force Majeure

Neither party shall be liable for delays or failures in performance due to circumstances beyond reasonable control, including:

  • Natural disasters, pandemics, or public health emergencies
  • Government actions, laws, or regulations
  • Labor strikes or disputes
  • Internet or telecommunications failures
  • Cyberattacks or security incidents

The affected party must provide prompt notice and use reasonable efforts to mitigate the impact.

13. Data Protection and Security

13.1 Data Processing

We process personal data according to our Privacy Policy and applicable data protection laws. For projects involving personal data, we may execute a separate Data Processing Agreement.

13.2 Security Measures

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect data, including:

  • Encryption of data in transit and at rest
  • Access controls and authentication requirements
  • Regular security assessments and monitoring
  • Incident response procedures

13.3 Data Breach Notification

We will notify clients of any security incidents affecting their data within 72 hours of discovery, in accordance with applicable laws.

14. General Provisions

14.1 Governing Law

These Terms are governed by the laws of South Africa. Any disputes will be resolved in the courts of Cape Town, South Africa.

14.2 Entire Agreement

These Terms, together with any applicable SOW, constitute the entire agreement between the parties and supersede all prior negotiations, representations, or agreements.

14.3 Amendments

Changes to these Terms must be in writing and signed by both parties. We may update these Terms for new engagements with reasonable notice.

14.4 Severability

If any provision is found unenforceable, the remaining provisions remain in full force and effect.

14.5 Assignment

Neither party may assign this agreement without written consent, except we may assign to affiliates or in connection with a merger or acquisition.
